intro: Ryticaryum gracile, commonly known as the slender ryticaryum, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Ryticaraceae and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, pale green leaves. The plant produces tiny, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species. Its botanical study is important for understanding the biodiversity of its native ecosystems.
